It was established in 1963, and during its path towards Educational Excellence, it bagged the honour of being a "Model School" in 1996. It has also been declared a "Smart" and "Mother Link School" in 2002 for its Consistent progress in maintaining educational standards.

publications: [{"title":"An Empirical Analysis of The Impact of Digital Financial Literacy on Financial Resilience","subtitle":"12th International Finance Conference - SIFICO 2023","description":"Keywords: Digital Financial Literacy, Financial Resilience, Logistic RegressionSkills: Primary Research, Scale Development, Binary Logistic Regression, EViews"},{"title":"Analysis of Banking Stability in the Digitalized UPI Economy: An Empirical Analysis","subtitle":"2nd Research Conference on BRICS 2023. Hosted by the University of Kota, India","description":"Keywords: Banking Stability, Digital Payments, BASEL Accords.Skills: Commercial Banking Analysis, Panel Data Analysis, Vector Autoregressive Regression (VAR), Vector Error Correction Model (VECM), Autoregressive Distributed Lag (ARDL), SPSS."},{"title":"DeFi: A Case for the Indian Economy - Systematic Literature Review and Research Directions","subtitle":"Chapter - Chapter IX - FinTech Blockchain Book (in Press)","description":"Keywords: Decentralized Financing, Blockchain, Policy ProposalSkills: Systematic Literature Review, Micro - Meso - Macro Analysis."},{"title":"Digital Payments: Bringing Financial Inclusion in a Cash Driven Economy","description":"Financial Inclusion is a key enabler of economic growth and development in an economy. The paper focuses on the impact and importance of the revolution in the financial technology sector in bringing financial inclusion to the unbanked population. A vast segment of the Indian population exists on the margins of the financial system. Against this background, the purpose of this research is to provide extant literature on financial inclusion through macroeconomic data of global and regional perspectives of enabling digital banks to bring financial inclusion to the cash-driven economy."}]
